items.title: Tesla’s market cap drops below $1t as Europe sales drop
items.summary:
- Tesla’s market capitalization falls below US$1 trillion after a decrease in shares for four consecutive sessions.
- The cumulative decline erased US$186 billion in market value.
- The company experienced a 45% drop in car sales in January across Europe, while the regional EV market grew by 37%.
- Analysts cite rising competition and controversies surrounding CEO Elon Musk as key factors affecting sales.
- As of Feb. 25, Tesla shares faced the largest decline among major technology stocks.

items.title: Enterprise HR firm Workday reports 15% revenue growth
items.summary:
- Workday reported a 15% year-over-year revenue increase for the quarter ending Jan. 31.
- Net income declined to US$94 million, or 35 cents per share, down from US$1.19 billion, or US$4.52 per share the previous year.
- The decline was mainly due to a US$1.1 billion tax-related valuation allowance that impacted last year’s results.
- There is a rising demand for Workday's AI tools.

items.title: Warner Bros. closes 3 studios, cancels Wonder Woman game
items.summary:
- Warner Bros. Discovery announced the closure of three video game development studios: Player First Games, Warner Bros. Games San Diego, and Monolith Productions.
- The decision, confirmed on Feb. 25, is aimed at improving profitability amid a challenging gaming market.
- Development of Monolith Productions’ “Wonder Woman” game will cease as it no longer fits the company’s strategic priorities despite the goal to create a quality experience for fans.

items.title: Bitcoin drops below $90k as selloff hits crypto market
items.summary:
- Bitcoin dropped to US$86,805 on Feb. 25, the lowest since mid-November.
- The cryptocurrency fell 8.5% in one day, down 20% since Trump's inauguration in January.
- Other cryptocurrencies like ether and XRP also fell, with steep drops recorded.
- Analysts attribute the decline to macroeconomic concerns and new tariffs from the Trump administration.
- Investor sentiment toward Bitcoin ETFs worsened, with significant outflows in February.
- Over US$1.6 billion in leveraged long-position losses occurred within two days.
- A US$1.5 billion hack at Bybit, linked to North Korean hackers, negatively impacted sentiment.

items.title: Intel-backed Ignite launches deeptech accelerator programs
items.summary:
- Intel-backed Ignite Deep Tech has launched updated acceleration programs for deeptech startups at various developmental stages.
- Programs include a flagship initiative for post-seed startups and a pre-seed program, supported by Intel and other partners.
- This follows the closure of Intel’s Ignite startup accelerator six months ago.
- Ignite Deep Tech became independent in December, backed by the Israel Innovation Authority, the Ministry of Economy, and Intel as its first client.
- The new programs aim to expand focus on early-stage deeptech ventures.

items.title: Indian insurtech firm Go Digit invests $3.4m in Dr Reddy’s
items.summary:
- Go Digit acquires a 0.32% stake in Dr. Reddy’s Laboratories for 30 crore rupees (US$3.4 million).
- The transaction is part of Go Digit's standard investment activities, confirmed in a regulatory filing.
- Dr. Reddy’s Laboratories, founded in 1984, specializes in pharmaceuticals including APIs, generics, biosimilars, and custom pharmaceutical services.
- Go Digit, established in 2017, provides digital non-life insurance policies in health, motor vehicle, travel, and property sectors.

items.title: Startup fraud in Asia may be blown out of proportion
items.author: Terence Lee, Queena Wadyanti
items.summary:
- Only 0.21% to 0.47% of startups in India and Southeast Asia faced public fraud allegations in the last five years.
- In comparison, 3% of large publicly traded firms in the US have been exposed for fraud, suggesting startups face far less fraud.
- High-profile fraud cases can give a misleading impression of the prevalence of startup fraud in the regions.
- The majority of known fraud cases are concentrated in a few firms, notably Byju's, which accounts for 75% of reported cases.
- Local investors may benefit from reduced competition for good deals amidst the fraud concerns.

items.title: Pinduoduo hires ex-Baidu experts to build AI models
items.summary:
- Pinduoduo is developing large-scale recommendation models led by a former Baidu AI team member.
- The models focus on price comparison, recommendations, advertising, search, and customer service.
- Pinduoduo has remained low-profile in AI, unlike its competitors.
- Job openings for NLP engineers were posted in November 2023 to explore AI in customer service.

items.title: India’s ePlane partners with Dubai-based Empire Aviation
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- The ePlane Company has partnered with Empire Aviation Group to deploy eVTOL vehicles in India, UAE, Thailand, and Indonesia.
- This partnership aims to establish urban air mobility solutions, with a focus on safety and fleet management.
- Founded in 2019 by IIT Madras professor Satya Chakravarthy, The ePlane Company is working to reduce traffic congestion with its eVTOL aircraft.
- Significant recent developments include raising $14M for eVTOL development and plans for a full launch of flying taxis by 2026.

items.title: Tumblr backs feed aggregator for the open social web
items.summary:
- Tumblr provides financial support for Tapestry, an app by The Iconfactory that aggregates feeds from RSS, Mastodon, and Bluesky.
- Tapestry, launched in February 2025 with over US$177,000 raised via crowdfunding, plans to develop a native macOS version using Tumblr's funding.
- The backing also funds a new sponsorship program connecting indie advertisers with Tapestry users.
- Tapestry aims to compete with apps like Surf, Feeeed, and Reeder by enhancing content customization and user control.
- Since Automattic's acquisition of Tumblr in 2019, the platform has further integrated with the fediverse, strengthening its position in the open social web.

items.title: CarDekho partners with Raya Holdings to enter UAE market
items.summary:
- CarDekho Group enters UAE market through partnership with Raya Holdings.
- Focuses on the used car market, offering lead management, advertising, and digital solutions.
- Plans to adapt its platform to meet UAE consumer preferences.
- COO Anurag Jain highlights the use of technology to meet regional customer needs.

items.title: Rakuten expands autonomous delivery with advanced robots
items.summary:
- Japan’s Rakuten Group will expand its autonomous delivery service on February 27, featuring advanced robots from US-based Avride.
- The service will cover all of Harumi and parts of Tsukishima and Kachidoki, increasing delivery points to over 90.
- The robots meet Japan’s Robot Delivery Association safety standards and will operate daily from 10:00 am to 9:00 pm with a delivery fee of 100 yen (US$0.67).

items.title: Apple shareholders vote to keep DEI initiatives
items.summary:
- Apple shareholders voted on February 25 against terminating DEI initiatives.
- The proposal to discontinue DEI programs was submitted by the National Center for Public Policy Research.
- Apple's board advised shareholders to reject the proposal, consistent with their previous stances.
- Other tech companies like Meta, Amazon, and Google are reevaluating their DEI efforts.

items.title: Flipkart-backed fintech super.money acquires BNPL startup
items.summary:
- super.money, supported by Flipkart, has acquired a Buy Now Pay Later (BNPL) startup.
- This acquisition aims to enhance super.money's financial services offerings.
- The deal indicates growing interest in BNPL solutions in the fintech sector.

items.title: Nazara acquires 60% stake in kids play center Funky Monkey
items.summary:
- Nazara Technologies acquires 60% stake in Funky Monkeys Play Centers for 43.7 crore rupee (US$5.01 million).
- The deal includes subscription of 3.61 lakh equity shares and purchase of 6.51 lakh shares.
- Funky Monkeys operates 11 indoor play centers in India and is now a subsidiary of Nazara.
- The acquisition aligns with Nazara’s expansion strategy announced in December 2024.
- Nazara reported record revenue of 534.7 crore rupee (US$61.37 million) in Q3 FY25, but net profit fell to 13.7 crore rupee (US$1.57 million).

items.title: PH tech firm Mosaic acquires HelixPay to unify its businesses
Elevation Capital chief operating officer steps down
items.summary:
- Vivek Mathur steps down as COO of Elevation Capital after 14 years.
- He plans to focus on advisory and mentorship roles.
- Mathur supported various startups including ACKO, FirstCry, and Paytm.
- He has over 30 years of experience in leadership roles at notable companies.
- His departure coincides with Elevation Capital strengthening its leadership team.
- Former Meta executive Krishna Mehra was appointed to lead SaaS and AI investments.

items.title: OpenAI expands deep research tool for all paid ChatGPT users
items.summary:
- OpenAI expands its deep research tool to all paying ChatGPT users including Plus, Team, Enterprise, and Edu subscribers.
- New users can now conduct up to 10 deep research queries monthly; Pro users have increased access to 120 queries.
- The feature was previously reserved for Pro subscribers costing US$200 per month.
- OpenAI continues to test and refine persuasive AI use cases amidst growing AI subscriptions.

items.title: Google launches free AI coding assistant for individuals
items.summary:
- Google has released a free version of its AI coding tool, Gemini Code Assist, for individual users on Feb. 25.
- The tool offers features like code completion, debugging, and code explanations via a chat interface integrated with VS Code and JetBrains.
- Gemini Code Assist allows up to 180,000 code completions monthly and 240 daily chat requests, surpassing GitHub Copilot's free plan.
- It includes a 128,000-token context window for analyzing larger codebases within a single request.
- Additionally, Google introduced Gemini Code Assist for GitHub to assist with pull requests, bug detection, and improvements.

items.title: India’s smartwatch shipments drop 30% as Apple jumps 141%
items.summary:
- Smartwatch shipments in India fell by 30%.  
- Apple saw a significant growth of 141% in the same period.  
- The article discusses market trends and impacts on different brands, specifically highlighting Apple's performance.

items.title: Emtek’s subsidiary boosts Bukalapak stake in $81.88m deal
items.summary:
- Kreatif Media Karya (KMK) increased its stake in PT Bukalapak.com Tbk by acquiring shares on Feb. 24, 2025.
- KMK bought 9.73 billion shares at 138 rupiah (US$0.01), totaling 1.34 trillion rupiah (US$81.88 million).
- KMK's ownership in Bukalapak rose from 24.61% to 34.05%, amounting to 35.12 billion shares controlled.

items.title: US private equity firm raises $1.9b for European software
items.summary:
- Thoma Bravo has raised €1.8 billion (US$1.9 billion) for its inaugural European fund to invest in midsized software companies across Europe.
- The firm has been active in Europe since acquiring Infovista in 2011 and has invested around €14 billion (US$14.73 billion) across 16 deals.
- Notable acquisition includes UK-based Darktrace for €5.3 billion (US$5.58 billion) in 2024.
- Thoma Bravo opened its first European office in London in 2023 to enhance its regional presence.
- The fund will focus on investment opportunities linked to Europe's digitization trends, supporting the growth strategies of local software companies.

items.title: Musk calls X ‘Twitter’ again in platform update talk
items.summary:
- Elon Musk referred to the platform as 'Twitter' in a post on February 24, 2025, despite rebranding it as 'X' in 2023.
- He mentioned the platform added more features with fewer staff during a discussion on updates.
- This marks another instance of Musk using Twitter's original name, indicating a lingering identity for the platform.

items.title: Agentic AI could usher in a new era of AI capabilities
items.summary:
- Agentic AI can make its own decisions to fulfill objectives without human prompting.
- Unlike traditional AI, which requires step-by-step instructions, agentic AI operates with broader end goals.
- Christopher Cai from AngelHack highlights the importance of policy and governance for agentic AI reliability.
- A self-directed learning aspect allows models to check their own outputs for accuracy.
- Implementing agentic AI in organizations faces challenges due to data integration across many existing systems.
- Adoption of agentic AI technologies may occur gradually, influenced by established regulations and policies.
- Significant industry interest from companies like Nvidia suggests rapid advancement and integration of this technology.

items.title: Alibaba to launch open-source video AI model
items.summary:
- Alibaba plans to release an open-source version of its video and image-generating AI model, Wan 2.1.
- A recorded video detailing the launch will be shared on Feb. 25 at 11 p.m. local time.
- This initiative comes amid rising competition in China's AI sector from companies like DeepSeek.
- The model is known for its capability to produce realistic visuals, having been introduced as Wanx in January before rebranding to Wan.

items.title: Israeli AI recruitment startup secures $23m seed funding
items.author: Eylon Etshtein
items.summary:
- Startup Perfect, based in Israel, has secured $23 million in seed funding.
- The funding will be used to develop an AI-driven recruitment platform that enhances sourcing and hiring processes.
- The platform assists hiring teams with drafting job postings, selecting distribution channels, and managing applications.
- It aims to compete with tools like Indeed, Recruiter, and LinkedIn.
- Perfect was founded by Eylon Etshtein, who has a background in facial recognition technology.

items.title: DeepSeek reopens AI model access after suspension
items.summary:
- DeepSeek, a Chinese AI startup, resumes API access after a three-week suspension.
- Service halted in early February due to capacity shortages, now restored for credit top-ups.
- Relaunch coincides with Alibaba's preview of its new AI model, QwQ-Max, highlighting competition in China's AI sector.

items.title: Vanguard warns Trump’s tariffs may raise inflation
items.summary:
- Vanguard International Semiconductor warns that US tariffs on semiconductor imports could lead to inflation and slow global economic growth.
- The company's direct exposure to these tariffs is expected to be minimal.
- Chairman Leuh Fang expressed uncertainty regarding the US administration’s tariff proposals, amidst ongoing trade tensions due to a proposed 25% tariff on imports including semiconductors.

items.title: Angkas shifts gears as Grab vies for PH motorcycle taxi crown
items.summary:
- RM, a motorcycle taxi driver, reports decreased earnings due to competition from Move It, a service acquired by Grab.
- Angkas, founded in 2016, has faced regulatory challenges and now competes with Move It and JoyRide amid uncertain regulations.
- The motorcycle taxi market in the Philippines is evolving, with more users becoming accustomed to the service, benefiting from formalized operations via apps.

items.title: Taiwan stocks drop 1.19% on AI fears, TSMC losses
items.summary:
- The Taiex index fell 279.59 points (1.19%) to close at 23,285.72 on Feb. 25.
- Decline attributed to Microsoft canceling data center leases, raising AI investment concerns.
- Total trading volume reached NT$392.17 billion (US$11.96 billion).
- TSMC, Taiwan’s largest stock, dropped 1.86% to NT$1,055.00 (US$33.76), contributing to the index's fall.

items.title: Joyy sells YY Live to Baidu for $2.1b
items.summary:
- Joyy sold its live streaming service YY Live to Baidu for approximately $2.1 billion in cash.
- The deal comprised an initial payment of $1.86 billion received in February 2021.
- An additional $240 million is expected to be received on February 25, 2025.
- YY Live was a significant part of Joyy’s business, which also includes other platforms like Bigo Live and Likee.

items.title: Apple and Indonesia said to agree to end iPhone 16 sales ban
items.summary:
- Apple and Indonesia have agreed to lift the ban on selling the iPhone 16, concluding a five-month standoff.
- Apple will invest $1 billion in Indonesia, focusing on local research and development.
- A memorandum of agreement will be signed this week, allowing iPhone 16 permits.
- The ban was enacted in October 2024 due to non-compliance with Indonesia's manufacturing regulations.
- There are no plans for Apple to manufacture iPhones in Indonesia.
- Possibility exists that the deal could fall through as no comments have been made by either party.

items.title: Microsoft cancels data center leases as $80b spending shifts focus
items.summary:
- Microsoft may face an oversupply of data centers, leading to lease terminations with private data center operators in the US.
- The company has canceled leases accounting for “a couple of hundred megawatts,” as part of a strategy shift.
- Microsoft plans to spend over $80 billion on infrastructure by 2025, but may adjust investments based on shifting priorities domestically and internationally.
- CEO Satya Nadella mentioned the need for data center expansion amid revenue generation delays from AI services in 2023.

items.title: Pandu Sjahrir now investment chief of ID’s sovereign wealth fund
items.summary:
- Pandu Sjahrir has been appointed as the investment chief of Indonesia’s sovereign wealth fund.
- This move is seen as a significant step in managing the fund's investment strategies.
- Sjahrir's expertise and background in investment are expected to benefit the fund's growth and development.

items.title: Grab’s going robotic?
items.summary:
- Grab is focusing on autonomous vehicles (AVs) and AI as part of its future strategy.
- The company reported positive adjusted EBITDA for the first time in 2024.
- CEO Anthony Tan indicated plans to transition to a hybrid AV-human fleet, with discussions ongoing with regulators.
- AI initiatives include a chatbot for merchants and plans for more personalized AI systems this year.
- Despite revenue growth, Grab's financial services arm remains loss-making, with expectations of profitability by the second half of next year.

items.title: These are the most active investors in Korea’s startups
Kredivo said to acquire Indonesia fintech GajiGesa
Chinese Robotics Firm Unveils First Humanoid Robot Frontflip
items.author: Zhao Tongyang
items.summary:
- EngineAI showcased a humanoid robot capable of performing a frontflip, demonstrated in a video on February 25.
- The robot, named PM01, stands at 1.38 meters tall and executed the flip successfully, albeit with a few stumbling steps afterward.
- Frontflips are considered more challenging for humanoid robots compared to backflips, previously achieved by companies like Boston Dynamics and Unitree.
- EngineAI, founded in 2023 by Zhao Tongyang, is known for its innovative robotics developments, including the SE01 model focused on natural walking.

items.title: Indonesia antitrust agency fines Carro $92k for late report
items.summary:
- The Indonesia Competition Supervisory Commission (KPPU) fined Trusty Cars Ltd 1.5 billion rupiah (approximately US$91,883).
- The fine was for failing to report the acquisition of a 50% stake in PT Mitra Pinasthika Mustika Rent (MPMRent) by the deadline of July 12, 2022, reporting it 12 working days late.
- KPPU determined the deal met mandatory notification thresholds but did not pose risks of monopolistic practices or unfair competition; Carro had cooperated and had no prior violations.

items.title: UK delays AI regulation bill to align with US strategy
items.summary:
- The UK government has postponed the AI regulation bill to ensure it aligns with the United States' strategy.
- This decision reflects the importance of transatlantic cooperation in shaping global AI policies.
- The delay aims to create a comprehensive regulatory framework that balances innovation and safety measures in AI technology.

items.title: Trump administration plans tighter chip limits on China
items.summary:
- The Trump administration plans to extend semiconductor restrictions on China, building on actions from the Biden administration.
- Japan and the Netherlands are discussing proposals to prevent engineers from servicing chip-making equipment in China.
- Tighter regulations on Nvidia’s chip exports and potential sanctions against Chinese firms are considered to limit advancements in AI and military technology.
- Officials support export limits on high-powered Nvidia chips and stricter licensing for GPUs.
- International discussions aim to revisit maintenance service limitations for semiconductor equipment in China.
- The AI diffusion rule is under review, with potential adjustments to lower export limits on computing power anticipated.

items.title: Aquatech firms swept by eFishery tide
items.summary:
- Agritech firms in Indonesia are struggling due to the fallout from **eFishery’s fraud scandal**.
- Some customers now view all tech startups as potentially dishonest, impacting the industry negatively.
- The business model of eFishery is under scrutiny, raising concerns among investors regarding risk assessment in the sector.

items.title: Tesla to introduce city navigation in China, sources say
items.summary:
- Tesla plans to introduce a city navigation feature for its driving assistance software in China, as reported on Feb. 24.
- This update aims to enhance the autopilot system for urban driving.
- The feature will be less advanced than the full self-driving capabilities in the US due to limited data on Chinese roads.
- A notification of the update was briefly visible on Tesla China's platform but was quickly retracted,
- Sources confirmed its authenticity, indicating it was released prematurely.
- Tesla has not made any comments regarding the update.

items.title: Gibran Huzaifah addresses eFishery fraud scandal for the first time
items.author: Putra Muskita
items.summary:
- Gibran Huzaifah, co-founder and ex-CEO of eFishery, addressed the fraudulent practices leading to his ousting in December 2024.
- An audit revealed that eFishery allegedly inflated its revenue by US$600 million, prompting significant layoffs.
- Huzaifah expressed regret for the impact on employees and fish farmers due to the scandal.

items.title: Series SEA: Who’s investing in the region’s health startups?
items.summary:
- The article discusses active investors in Southeast Asia’s health scene.
- A list of investors is provided, focusing on those who have backed at least three companies in the last two years.
- The data is constantly updated, emphasizing the focus on early-stage investors and their impact.

items.title: US fintech firm Brex targets $500m revenue, eyes IPO in 2025
items.author: Pedro Franceschi, Henrique Dubugras
items.summary:
- Brex aims for US$500 million in revenue by 2025 and is considering an IPO.
- CEO Pedro Franceschi states the goal is to achieve cash-flow positivity by mid-2025.
- The company offers corporate cards, business bank accounts, and expense management software, generating revenue from various services.
- Valued at US$12.3 billion in January 2022, Brex has faced challenges from a startup-heavy client base.
- To reduce cash burn, Brex cut workforce from 1,400 to 1,100 employees and reduced cash burn by 82% year-over-year.
- The shift towards enterprise clients resulted in an 80% increase in enterprise net revenue in 2024.

items.title: Japan semiconductor stocks drop on US-China chip woes
items.summary:
- Japanese semiconductor equipment makers saw sharp declines in stock prices on February 25.
- Tokyo Electron Ltd. experienced a drop of 4.4%, its largest decline in two weeks, with 44% of its revenue from China.
- Advantest Corp. and Kokusai Electric Corp. both lost over 5%, while Screen Holdings Co. also fell by 4.4%.
- Analysts attribute the declines to investor concerns over tighter US restrictions on China’s chip industry.
- Andrew Jackson from Ortus Advisors noted that the report caused an immediate selloff among investors.
- The selloff coincided with broader weakness in Japan’s tech sector, exacerbated by Microsoft's cancellation of some data center leases affecting AI demand.

items.title: Anthropic seeks $3.5b funding, eyes $61.5b valuation
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Anthropic, an AI startup, aims to raise US$3.5 billion at a US$61.5 billion valuation.
- Potential investors include Lightspeed Venture Partners, General Catalyst, and Bessemer Venture Partners.
- The funding target exceeds a previous goal of US$2 billion, indicating strong interest in AI startups in the US.
- Anthropic's valuation reflects the competitive landscape in AI, with OpenAI also pursuing a US$300 billion valuation.
- Founded by Dario and Daniela Amodei, Anthropic was valued at US$18 billion in 2024 and recently launched Claude 3.7 Sonnet.

items.title: Starbucks to cut 1,100 corporate jobs
items.summary:
- Starbucks will eliminate 1,100 corporate positions as part of restructuring on Feb. 24.
- Layoffs include corporate support roles and several hundred unfilled positions, according to CEO Brian Niccol.
- The company aims to remove redundancies and improve cross-department collaboration amid declining demand for premium beverages in key markets like the US and China.

items.title: India’s smaller cities drive $1.9b crypto boom: report
items.summary:
- Interest in cryptocurrency trading is rising among young Indians to supplement income.
- Trading volumes for cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin and Ethereum on India’s largest exchanges exceeded $1.9 billion in Q4 2024.
- Lower-tier cities such as Jaipur, Lucknow, and Pune account for seven of the top ten cities in crypto activity.
- The Indian crypto market is projected to reach $15 billion by 2035, up from $2.5 billion in 2024 according to Grant Thornton Bharat.
